articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Cameroonian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Cameroonian President 
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, on May 17 sent a message of greetings to Paul Biya, president of Cameroon, on the 39th birthday of its Republic.
					Kim in the message heartily wished the Cameroonian President greater success in the work to promote the national unity and achieve the social stability.

articles.title: Performance Given by Art Group of Kim Hyong Jik Univ.
articles.content:
Performance Given by Art Group of Kim Hyong Jik Univ.
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A performance by the art group of Kim Hyong Jik University of Education has been under way before full house at the People's Palace of Culture since May 14.
					 Appreciating the performance were service persons of the Korean People's Army and the Korean People's Interior Forces, officials of ministries, national institutions, in the fields of literature and arts and media, creators, artistes, students and working people in Pyongyang. 
					
					 The performance began with chorus "Glory to Our Great Party" and poem and song "Before Signboard Bearing the Autograph of the Fatherly Leader". It included colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers represented the shining history of the university in which it has developed into a center for training native cadres and a pedigree establishment for educating the younger generation under the wise leadership of peerlessly great persons.
					
					 They also truthfully depicted the life of the students preparing themselves as revolutionary talents possessed of versatile knowledge, sound spirit and noble traits.
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: Universities Contribute to Economic Development
articles.content:
Universities Contribute to Economic Development
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- University teachers and researchers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have rendered services to the development of economic sectors.
					 Kim Il Sung University has helped update some of the production processes at the Namhung Youth Chemical Complex and upgrade the quality of pencil lead at the Pyongyang Mechanical Pencil Factory.
					
					 It has also renewed the production method of fermented feed and microorganism feed additives at the Tudan Duck Farm to boost meat output.
					
					 Kim Chaek University of Technology has offered assistance to the 
					
					Kim Jong Suk Pyongyang Silk Mill, Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex, Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, Tanchon Refinery and Unryul Mine in their technological updating.
					
					 Pyongyang University of Railways, Hamhung University of Chemical Engineering, Huichon University of Technology and Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy have also made a scientific contribution to factories, power stations and tideland reclamation.
					
					 Kim Je Won Haeju University of Agriculture and Nampho University of Agriculture have applied their scientific achievements to the Migok Co-op Farm in Sariwon City, Samjigang Co-op Farm in Jaeryong County, Chongsan Co-op Farm in Kangso District and Mangyongdae Vegetable Farm in Mangyongdae District.

articles.title: FIFA Refereeing Course Held
articles.content:
FIFA Refereeing Course Held
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A FIFA refereeing course was held in Pyongyang from May 11 to 15.
					 International and national referees of the DPRK participated in the course, which was held at Kim Il Sung Stadium, divided into theoretical and practical workshops. 
					
					 The course dealt with the role of referee and sub-referee, game tactics and analysis, and physical training method of referees.
					
					 Another FIFA course for refereeing supervision took place on May 16 and 17.
					
					 The courses were undertaken by FIFA lecturers Azimi Abdullah, Mohamad Rodzali Yacob and Ahmad Khalidi Supian.

articles.title: New Hepatitis Medicine Developed
articles.content:
New Hepatitis Medicine Developed
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Pharmacy Research Institute of the Academy of Medical Science recently developed leu-val hepatitis transfusion.
					 The amino-acid transfusion is efficacious for liver cirrhosis, liver dropsy and hepatic coma.
					
					 The medicine is made of raw materials available in the country.
					
					 Some hospitals like the North and South Hwanghae provincial people's hospitals have already begun to manufacture the medicine to treat those with a liver trouble.

articles.title: Solidarity Action for Checking Conclusion of FTA Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Solidarity Action for Checking Conclusion of FTA Declared in S. Korea
Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions and the Industrial Workers' Union of the Confederation of Labor of the U.S. at a joint press conference in Seoul on May 16 declared that they would stage a solidarity action for checking the conclusion of the south Korea-U.S. "FTA", according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The organizations said that FTA only meets the interests of a tiny handful of businesses.
					
					 They stressed that they would make the voices of the labor circle opposing the conclusion of FTA heard and wage in a sustainable manner the actions to check its conclusion in alliance with civic and public organizations of various circles.

articles.title: Seminar on Reunification Held in Japan
articles.content:
Seminar on Reunification Held in Japan
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A seminar on reunification of Korea was held in Tokyo on May 16 to mark the 11th anniversary of the June 15 joint declaration.
					 Speakers said that since the publication of the joint declaration all Koreans in the north and the south and abroad have worked hard to achieve national reconciliation and unity under the banner of "By our nation itself" and waged a strenuous movement for national reunification. 
					
					 But the emergence of the Lee Myung Bak regime put the implementation of the joint declaration at an ordeal and increased the danger of war on the Korean Peninsula, they held.
					
					 They called upon the forces for independence, democracy and reunification to resolutely reject the fascist dictatorial rule of the present regime in south Korea in solidarity and unity.

articles.title: Brazilian Party Lauds Kim Il Sung's Idea on National Unity
articles.content:
Brazilian Party Lauds Kim Il Sung's Idea on National Unity
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Brazilian Communist Party posted an article on its Internet website on May 5 to mark the 75th anniversary of the Association for the Restoration of the Fatherland.
					 The article said that in the DPRK a dynamic drive is now being conducted to realize the independent and peaceful reunification of Korea by the great unity of the whole nation in the idea of "By our nation itself".
					
					 It is the fixed faith and will of the Korean people that national reunification will be surely realized if all the compatriots in the north and the south and overseas achieve the great national unity irrespective of ideology, ism, system, religious belief and affiliation, it stressed.
					
					 The great unity of the entire nation in Korea has its deep root, the article said, adding:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung's idea on great national unity has been successfully carried forward by General Secretary Kim Jong Il.
					
					 It is the unshakable resolution and will of the leader to reunify the country on the strength of great national unity by defending and steadily inheriting the President's idea, exploits, experience and tradition of great national unity.

articles.title: Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Britain
articles.content:
Decision on Holding World Conference on Juche Idea Hailed in Britain
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea and the British Association for the Study of Songun Policy released a joint statement on May 14 in support of the decision of the 13th enlarged meeting of the Executive Committee of the Board of Directors of the International Institute of the Juche Idea.
					 It is of very weighty significance to convene a world conference on the Juche idea next year marking the centenary of birth of President Kim Il Sung, founder of the immortal Juche idea, the statement said, adding:
					
					 We are sure that the world conference will make a significant contribution to commemorating the Day of the Sun in 2012 with splendor.
					
					 The conference will mark an important occasion in activating the study and dissemination of the Juche idea and further promote the unity of the progressive humankind aspiring after independence.
					
					 We will widely introduce the world conference in Britain and attend it with greater success in the study and dissemination of the Juche idea.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Finnish Internet Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Posted on Finnish Internet Website
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 12 posted on its Internet website the full text of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "On the Juche Idea".
					 The work, published on March 31, Juche 71 (1982), expounds the immortal historical feat of President Kim Il Sung who founded the Juche idea and its significance, the foundation of the Juche idea and its philosophical principle, socio-historical principles, guiding principles and historical significance.
					
					 The website carried photos on Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities and said in its preface:
					
					 The Juche idea has greatly encouraged the struggle of the people and organizations aspiring after independence and enriched the scientific theory on socialism.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, the Korean people have achieved successes in building a great prosperous and powerful nation true to the behests of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 The validity and vitality of the Juche idea fathered by Kim Il Sung are being proved more clearly today when people in many countries struggle against the imperialists' reactionary policies and scheme for "globalization", holding higher the banner of independence.

articles.title: Mexican Organization Issues Bulletin
articles.content:
Mexican Organization Issues Bulletin
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea issued information bulletin No. 76 titled "Invariable Banner of Korea's Reunification" on the occasions of the 11th anniversary of the publication of the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration and the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The bulletin in an article said:
					
					 The June 15 north-south joint declaration is called a milestone of Korea's reunification.
					
					 Over a decade has passed but the idea of "By our nation itself", basic spirit of the declaration, keeps serving as an invariable banner of Korea's reunification.
					
					 It is because this idea is consistent with the transparent spirit of national independence.
					
					 The miraculous reality created on the Korean Peninsula after the publication of the joint declaration eloquently showed that reunification can surely be achieved when the whole nation gets united.
					
					 Korea's reunification will finally come true when all the Koreans perfectly embody the spirit of the great unity.
					
					 The idea of "By our nation itself" provides a fundamental guarantee for defending peace.
					
					 Today the Korean Peninsula has become one of the world's hotspots.
					
					 The south Korean authorities took active part in the U.S. persistent policy to stifle the DPRK and pose military threat, rendering the regional situation extremely tense. 
					
					 Had the south Korean authorities respected the idea of "By our nation itself" the situation on the peninsula would not have been put in such crisis as now.
					
					 There is no other way than to implement the joint declaration in realizing Korea's reunification.

articles.title: Nepali Newspaper on Juche Idea
articles.content:
Nepali Newspaper on Juche Idea
						
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Nepali newspaper Arpan on May 6 carried an article titled "Philosophical Principle of the Juche Idea".
					 The article stressed that the Juche idea is a man-centered new philosophical idea.
					
					 The Juche idea raised the fundamental problem of philosophy by centering on man and expounded the philosophical principle that man is master of everything and decides everything, it said, adding:
					
					 The philosophical principle of the Juche idea clarified the position and role of man in the world.
					
					 Man is a social being with independence, creativity and consciousness.
					
					 Man is the most powerful being that approaches the world revolutionarily and actively, not fatally and passively, and transforms it purposefully and consciously, not blindly.
					
					 As a social-being, man is the only master and transformer of the world.

articles.title: Radiation Crisis Deepens in Japan
articles.content:
Radiation Crisis Deepens in Japan 
						
Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Radiation crisis caused by the accident at the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant is gaining in depth in Japan.
					 Tokyo Shimbun issued the survey data obtained from the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology about the amount of radioactive materials detected in 24 hours in Tohoku area and prefectures of Kanto region till 5 p.m. May 17. 
					
					 According to it, radiation in Tochigi Prefecture was 0.07 millisieverts per hour, again exceeding the highest level in ordinary times while that in Ibaragi and Saitama prefectures rose to 0.103 millisieverts per hour and 0.06 millisieverts per hour. 
					
					 It is reported that radiation in Namie Cho, Fukushima Prefecture was 17.8 millisieverts at 11:23 May 17. 
					
					 Radioactive materials exceeding the tolerance level were detected in oak tree mushroom and bamboo shoots cultivated in Fukushima Prefecture amid the amount of radiation constantly rising in the quake-ravaged areas.
					
					 The TEPCO, quoting the results of analysis, clarified that the nuclear fuel of No. 1 reactor of the Fukushima Nuclear Power Plant was proved to have been totally exposed and melted down five hours after mega quake and ensuing tsunami.
					
					 It was so far considered that the nuclear fuel meltdown started on March 12.

articles.title: 166 Nuclear Power Plants under Construction and Plan Worldwide
articles.content:
166 Nuclear Power Plants under Construction and Plan Worldwide
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The number of the nuclear power plants under construction and plan reached 166 worldwide as of the outset of this year or 26 more than what was surveyed last year, according to Asahi Shimbun on May 16. 
					 436 nuclear power plants are now in operation, it added.

articles.title: Russian Deputy PM on Government Delegation's Visit to Kuril Islands
articles.content:
Russian Deputy PM on Government Delegation's Visit to Kuril Islands
 Moscow, May 17 (KCNA) -- Russian Deputy Prime Minister Sergei Ivanov at a press conference in Vladivostok on May 16 referred to the government delegation's visit to Kuril Islands.
					 As regards the Japanese authorities' protest against the Russian government delegation's visit to Kuril Islands, he said the delegation's visit was of technical nature, not to anger anyone under any circumstances.
					
					 The purpose of the delegation's visit was to acquaint itself on the spot with the implementation of the federal plan adopted in 2007, he added.

articles.title: Russia Warns US against Building MD in Europe
articles.content:
Russia Warns US against Building MD in Europe
 Moscow, May 17 (KCNA) -- The vice-minister of Foreign Affairs of Russia recently warned the U.S. against building the missile defense system in Europe.
					 If the U.S. deploys MD elements in Europe, Russia will pull out of the new START, he said.
					
					 As already warned several times, Russia will have no option but to examine the issue of its withdrawal from the treaty as clarified in it in case the U.S. MD poses threat to the strategic nuclear armed forces of Russia, he stressed.

articles.title: Syria Denounces Israeli Army for Its Repressive Moves
articles.content:
Syria Denounces Israeli Army for Its Repressive Moves
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Syria in a statement Sunday condemned the crimes Israel practiced against Palestinians.
					 Hundreds of Palestinians tried Sunday to cross the separation line between Israel and Syria when they came under the Israeli fire.
					
					 Two Palestinians were killed and 72 others were wounded in the Israeli attack. The statement denounced these practices as criminal act.
					
					 Israel is continuing to abuse human rights in disregard of international law, it said, urging the international community to hold Israel fully responsible for these practices.

articles.title: Abbas Promises Not to Give up Refugee's Right of Return
articles.content:
Abbas Promises Not to Give up Refugee's Right of Return
						
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Palestinian National Authority President Mahmoud Abbas on Saturday promised not to make any concession on the Palestinian refugees' right of return.
					 All the Palestinians have the legitimate right to get together and live in their homeland, he said, stressing that they will never give up this right.
					
					 He said that the refugees' case was one of the basic issues in final-status negotiations with Israel, recalling that Israel doesn't want to discuss the issues of refugees.

articles.title: Israeli Army's Ceaseless Suppression of Palestinians
articles.content:
Israeli Army's Ceaseless Suppression of Palestinians 
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The Israeli army is resorting to ceaseless repression of Palestinians, aggravating the regional situation.
					 Forty-five Palestinians were wounded on Sunday as Israeli troops opened fire on Palestinians holding demonstration in demand of the Palestinian refugees' right to return home in the Gaza Strip.
					
					 The Israeli army arrested more than 30 innocent Palestinians in East Kuds on the same day.

articles.title: Iran Says West Tries to Deprive It of Peaceful Nuclear Activities
articles.content:
Iran Says West Tries to Deprive It of Peaceful Nuclear Activities
 Tehran, May 17 (KCNA) -- Iran's Majlis (Parliament) Speaker Ali Larijani said in a recent interview that the West was trying to deprive Iran of its peaceful nuclear activities.
					 Larijani said that previous experiences have shown that western states were trying to deprive Iran of its peaceful nuclear activities.
					
					 Iran has turned to a nuclear country with peaceful activities, said Larijani, adding that Tehran was pursuing a completely reasonable strategy concerning its nuclear issue.

articles.title: Iran Launches First Natural Gas Reservoir
articles.content:
Iran Launches First Natural Gas Reservoir
						
 Tehran, May 17 (KCNA) -- Iranian Deputy Oil Minister Javad Owji said Sunday that Iran launched the country's first underground natural gas storage facility in the central province of Qom.
					 The Qom reservoir has the capacity to store 3.3 billion cubic meters of natural gas a year.
					
					 Iran has the world's second largest gas reserves.

articles.title: Iran Warns West on Drug Transit
articles.content:
Iran Warns West on Drug Transit 
						
 Tehran, May 17 (KCNA) -- Javad Larijani, secretary-general of the High Council for Human Rights of Iran, on May 14 clarified Iran's stand of categorically rejecting the West's interference in internal affairs of Iran. 
					 He threatened that Iran will allow the transit of illegal drugs through its territory to Europe if the West continues to criticize the Islamic nation for its practice of executing drug traffickers, branding it as interference in internal affairs of Iran.

articles.title: China Calls for Multilateralism
articles.content:
China Calls for Multilateralism
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Zheng Wantong, vice-chairman of the National Committee of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, called for multilateralism when having a talk with the president of the UN General Assembly at its headquarters recently.
					 He said that no country is allowed to think of itself only but pursue multilateralism now that the multi-polarization of the world is gaining in depth and it is necessary to address such worldwide problems as the international financial crisis, climate change and energy security and food security. 
					
					 He noted that it is an inevitable option.

articles.title: Belarus Condemns West's Sanctions
articles.content:
Belarus Condemns West's Sanctions
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The director of the Information Department of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of Belarus on May 12 condemned the West's sanctions against the country.
					 The West is scheming to apply new economic sanctions against Belarus. This is an attempt to destroy the stability of the country, he said.
					
					 If the West applies economic sanctions, Belarus will take a countermeasure, he stressed.
					
					 He demanded the West immediately lift the political and economic pressure from his country.

articles.title: CYV on Validity of Bolivarian Revolution
articles.content:
CYV on Validity of Bolivarian Revolution
						
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The general secretary of the Communist Youth of Venezuela (CYV) recently underscored the validity of the Bolivarian Revolution when interviewed by the Cuban newspaper Juventud Rebelde.
					 He said that the counterrevolutionary elements receiving financial aid from the U.S. are trying to prevent the cause of national liberation of the country from advancing but the Bolivarian Revolution is supported by the absolute majority of the popular masses.
					
					 The communist youth organization comprising a number of youth has played a big role in the development of the revolution, in particular, he said.

articles.title: 170 NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan This Year
articles.content:
170 NATO Soldiers Killed in Afghanistan This Year
						
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Two NATO soldiers were killed by the resistance forces in Afghanistan's southern region on May 13 and 15.
					 More than 170 NATO soldiers have been killed in Afghanistan since beginning this year.

articles.title: Earthquake Jolts Costa Rica
articles.content:
Earthquake Jolts Costa Rica
 Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A 6-magnitude earthquake jolted Costa Rica on May 14.
					 The epicenter was the central area of the country.

articles.title: Terminados cursillos de la FIFA
articles.content:
Terminados cursillos de la FIFA
Pyongyang, 19 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar del día 11 al 15 en el capitalino Estadio Kim Il Sung el cursillo de árbitros de la FIFA.
					En el cursillo, que se impartió dividido en la teoría y la práctica, participaron los árbitros internacionales y nacionales de Corea.
					
					Fueron tratados muchos temas, entre otros, el papel de árbitros principales y auxiliares, la táctica de la competencia y su análisis, y el método de entrenamiento físico de los árbitros.
					
					Por otra parte, se realizó del día 16 al 17 el cursillo de los inspectores de arbitraje de la FIFA.
					
					Los cursillos estuvieron a cargo de los lectores de la FIFA, Azimi Abdullah, Mohamad Rodzali Yacob y Ahmad Khalidi Supian.

articles.title: Profesores e investigadores contribuyen a economía nacional
articles.content:
Profesores e investigadores contribuyen a economía nacional
						
Pyongyang, 19 de mayo (ATCC) -- Los profesores e investigadores de las universidades a lo largo del país solucionan satisfactoriamente los problemas científico-técnicos que se presentan en la industria ligera, la agricultura y los sectores priorizados de economía nacional y las industrias básicas.
					Los eruditos de la Universidad Kim Il Sung toman parte activa en la modernización de algunos procesos del Complejo Químico Juventud de Namhung y en el mejoramiento de la calidad de minas en la Fábrica de Portaminas de Pyongyang.
					
					Además contribuyen al incremento de la producción de carne en la Granja de Patos de Tudan profundizando los estudios sobre los piensos fermentados y los aditamentos hechos con microbios.
					
					El grupo de investigación de la Universidad Politécnica Kim Chaek desempeña un papel importante en la modernización de la Hilandería         Kim Jong Suk de Pyongyang, el Complejo Siderúrgico Kim Chaek, el Complejo Siderúrgico de Hwanghae, la Fundición de Metales no Ferrosos de Tanchon, la Mina de Unryul, etc.
					
					Los intelectuales de otros planteles docentes como la Universidad de Ferrocarriles de Pyongyang, la Universidad de Industria Química de Hamhung, la Universidad de Industria de Huichon y la Universidad de Minería y Metalurgia de Chongjin realizan méritos similares en las fábricas y empresas importantes, centrales eléctricas y lugares de roturación de marismas de todo el país.
					
					Por otra parte, la Universidad de Agricultura Kim Je Won de Haeju y la Universidad de Agricultura de Nampho aplican valiosos éxitos de investigación en la producción de las Granjas Cooperativas de Migok de la ciudad de Sariwon, de Samjigang del distrito de Jaeryong y de Chongsan del municipio de Kangso y la Granja Cooperativa Especializada en Verduras de Mangyongdae del municipio homónimo de esta capital.

articles.title: Entidades británicas apoyan resolución de 13ª reunión ampliada
articles.content:
Entidades británicas apoyan resolución de 13ª reunión ampliada
Pyongyang, 19 de mayo (ATCC) -- En apoyo a la resolución sobre la convocatoria de la Conferencia Mundial sobre la Idea Juche, adoptada en la 13ª reunión ampliada del Comité Ejecutivo del Consejo del Instituto Internacional de la Idea Juche, el Grupo de Estudio de la Idea Juche y la Asociación de Estudio de la Política de Songun, de Gran Bretaña, hicieron pública el día 14 una declaración conjunta.
					La nota señala que tiene una enorme importancia la convocación de esa conferencia en 2012, año del centenario de nacimiento del Presidente Kim Il Sung, fundador de la inmortal idea Juche y prosigue:
					
					Manifestamos la convicción de que la conferencia contribuirá especialmente a la celebración solemne del Día del Sol (15 de abril) de 2012. 
					
					Ese conclave será una oportunidad importante para dinamizar el estudio y la divulgación de la idea Juche y fomentará la unidad de la humanidad progresista aspirante a la independencia.
					
					Seremos divulgadores activos en nuestro país sobre la Conferencia Mundial sobre la Idea Juche y asistiremos a ella con el orgullo de haber logrado mayores éxitos en el estudio y la propaganda de ese pensamiento.

articles.title: Función artística de estudiantes de universidad pedagógica
articles.content:
Función artística de estudiantes de universidad pedagógica 
Pyongyang, 19 de mayo (ATCC) -- Tiene lugar desde el día 14 en el Palacio Cultural del Pueblo la función del grupo artístico de la Universidad Pedagógica Kim Hyong Jik.
					  La vieron los militares del Ejército Popular de Corea y de las Fuerzas Populares del Interior de Corea, los funcionarios de ministerios, órganos centrales y sectores de prensa e información, los creadores, artistas, estudiantes y trabajadores en la capital.
					
					  Los ejecutantes pusieron en la escena el coro "Gloria a nuestro gran Partido", la poesía y canción "Ante el letrero con la firma del Líder padre" y otras piezas.
					
					  Demostraron la historia gloriosa del plantel docente que vino desarrollándose como la base de formación de cuadros nacionales y el centro para la educación de las generaciones venideras.
					
					  Además, describieron vividamente la vida de los estudiantes que se preparan como personas de la revolución con los conocimientos polifacéticos, el espíritu sano y nobles rasgos.
					
					 La función continúa.
